pageContext.claim: “I've talked to four of them today and they speak a language that most people do not understand but I understand something … they’ve really advanced therapeutics and therapeutically and they've arrived in London already, their London office has whatever they need and we will see if we can be of help. We've contacted all of Boris [Johnson]’s doctors and we'll see what is going to take place but they are ready to go.”
pageContext.analysis: None of the treatments that Trump touted from four U.S. “genius” drug companies as possible aids for ailing British Prime Minister Boris Johnson were clinically tested for coronavirus or available on the market. "Downing Street has indicated it does not wish to take up Trump’s offer of experimental drugs," The Guardian reported.
